Package algorithms.misc

Class NumberTheory

java.lang.Object
algorithms.misc.NumberTheory
public class NumberTheory extends Object
implemented from pseudocode from Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest, and Stein "Introduction to Algorithms", Chap 31 first implemented in project http://github.com/nking/curvature-scale-space-corners-and-transformations w/ Copyright (c) 2014 Climb With Your Feet and using The MIT License (MIT) then moved here to share with other projects.
Author:
nichole

    • gcdModularLinearEqnSolver

      public static long[] gcdModularLinearEqnSolver(long a, long b, long n)
      solves for x in the equation a * x â‰¡ b (mod n) (which is actually (a*x) % n = b) where d is the gcd of number n and d|b (a.k.a. d divides b). finds the smallest gcd for which a*x + b*y = d. The equation may have zero, one, or more than one such solution. performs O(lg n + gcd(a, n)) arithmetic operations. 
       Section 31.4, Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest, and Stein Introduction to Computer Algorithms.
      Parameters:
      a - positive number greater than 0
      b - positive number greater than 0
      n -
      Returns:

    • extendedEuclid

      public static long[] extendedEuclid(long a, long b)
      extended euclid returns d, x, and y where d = gcd(a, b) = a*x + b*y where x and y may be zero or negative. x and y are useful for forming multiplicative inverses. if a .gt. b .geq. 0, runtime complexity is O(log_2(b)).
      Parameters:
      a -
      b -
      Returns:
      returns d, x, and y where d = gcd(a, b) = a*x + b*y where x and y may be zero or negative. x and y are useful for forming multiplicative inverses.

    • leastCommonMultiple

      public static long leastCommonMultiple(long a, long b)
      the least common multiple, lowest common multiple, or smallest common multiple of two integers a and b, usually denoted by lcm(a, b), is the smallest positive integer that is divisible by both a and b. e.g. for a=12, b=18, result= 12/2 * 18/2 = 6*6 = 36 
       reference:
 https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Least_common_multiple
      Parameters:
      a -
      b -
      Returns:
